availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jeremiah Davidson (Greenup County attorney and newspaper publisher)

body.p: Greenup County, Kentucky, attorney. Lawrence County, Ohio, native. Son of John Davidson and Margaret Davidson. Married to Eliza A. Corum Davidson in December 1834. Father of Henry C. Davidson, Charles W. Davidson, Theodore F. Davidson, Edgar P. Davidson, and Miss Annie M. Davidson. Moved to Greenup County, Kentucky, in October 1832. Hotel keeper in Greenup County from 1832 to 1843. Admitted to the bar on October 31, 1846. Magistrate and justice of the peace in Greenup County. Attorney in Greenup County in 1860. Editor and proprietor of the Greenup Record. First common-school commissioner under the public school law of Kentucky, and held the office several terms.

ab.bibl:
W. H. Perrin, J. H. Battle, and G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State, 6th ed. (Louisville and Chicago: F. A. Battey and Company, 1886).
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, East Little Sandy, p. 4.
